page.title: 02GENERAL REVIEW OF 05080393
page.content: The Claxby/Usselby area is in north Lincolnshire on the edge of the Lincoln wolds, situated approximately 18 miles south west of Grimsby and 23 miles north east of Lincoln. The Cleethorpes - Newark railway and A46 trunk road run through the area and separate the two villages of Claxby and Usselby. The area is mainly flat agricultural land at approximately 100-125 feet A.O.D. rising sharply to higher grazing land in the east at 530 feet. This higher land formed by a limestone edge is the western extremity of the Lincolnshire wolds. The population is small and mainly concentrated in the two villages but there are also several outlying farms.
